meanings.definition: To deliberately destroy or damage property
meanings.sent1: The naughty child vandalises the sandcastle at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The criminal vandalises the park benches by breaking them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon vandalises the picnic area by knocking over trash cans.
meanings.sent4: The storm angrily vandalises the fragile sand dunes along the coast.
meanings.sent5: The careless skateboarder vandalises the public property by grinding on ledges and rails.

meanings.definition: To deface or spoil something, especially with graffiti or other markings
meanings.sent1: The graffiti artist vandalises the blank wall with colorful spray paint.
meanings.sent2: The vandals vandalise the school walls with rude words and drawings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous students vandalise the chalkboard with doodles during class.
meanings.sent4: The vines slowly vandalise the old building, creeping up the walls and windows.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully vandalises the canvas with bold strokes of paint, creating a masterpiece.
